CricketMatch.MatchReport:
In a well-contested game on Saturday, in perfect conditions, Twyford narrowly lost out at the end of a game full of twists and turns. After having lost the toss and being put into bat by the young Yateley side Twyford looked to have got of to a solid start before Kemp offered his wicket to extra cover with the score on 16. Luckily Connor (60) and Hobson (45) had found their form and were able to score steadily against some excellent bowling particularly from Massey (2-58). After a partnership of 87, and with 15 overs left Hobson was caught trying to sweep. The wickets of Henry (16) and Jackson (5) followed on quickly and then Downes marched to the wicket. He combined some frantic swishes of the bat with some hefty blows, including four sixes. Downes (45*) was ably supported by Connor, who provided the backbone of the innings with some classy shots. The innings came to a close on 194 which although not a huge total on the dry and hard pitch was at least something to bowl at.

Yateley's reply was ferocious in nature. Massey (65), a well-known local player, punished even the good balls but always looked to take the arial route. After a couple of costly dropped catches he finally holed out to Edney of the bowling of Potier, a just reward for some excellent bowling. With the score on 91 and with only 104 needed from 27 overs Twyford had a chance to get back into the game. Wickets fell to both Downes and Jackson and kept the visitors scoring slowly and feeling the pressure. The Yateley side were reolute and even the late wickets from Hobson (2-18) never looked like being enough and Yateley eventually hit the winning runs in the 43rd over.
